net.hudup.listener

Class SocketServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.hudup.core.logistic.AbstractRunner
      • net.hudup.listener.SocketServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, java.rmi.Remote, Server, Runner
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Listener

    public abstract class SocketServer
extends AbstractRunner
implements Server
    This abstract class implement partly the interface Server in order to setting up partially the server that support the popular socket connection. In current implementation, the Listener, which inherits directly this SocketServer, is the complete server with socket connection.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen

    • Field Detail

      • config

        protected ServerConfig config
        Server configuration.

      • serverSocket

        protected java.net.ServerSocket serverSocket
        The Java ServerSocket of socket connection. This socket is main object of SocketServer.

      • listenerList

        protected javax.swing.event.EventListenerList listenerList
        List of event listeners of this socket server. Popular listeners are server status listeners represented by ServerStatusListener interface. Every time server change its current status, it notifies an event ServerStatusEvent to ServerStatusListener (s). However this list can contains other registered listeners.

      • timer

        protected java.util.Timer timer
        The timer for making scheduler of server tasks.

      • shutdownHookStatus

        protected boolean shutdownHookStatus
        Indicator of hook status. Before socket server is shut down and discarded, a hook operator is performed. If this indicator is true, the hook operator is being done. When this indicator is false, the hook operator was done. Following is the code snippet of hook operator:

        shutdownHookStatus = true;
        shutdown();
        shutdownHookStatus = false;

      • shutdown

        protected void shutdown()
                 throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Shutting down this socket server. After shut down, the server is discarded and cannot be re-started.

      • delegate

        protected abstract AbstractDelegator delegate(java.net.Socket socket)
        When socket server receive incoming request, it dispatches such request to a delegator represented by AbstractDelegator so that such delegator handles and processes the request. This method is responsible for creating the delegator with specified network socket at first. Later on method task() will dispatch incomming request to the returned delegator.
        Parameters:
        socket - specified network socket
        Returns:
        returned delegator which handles and processes incoming request later.

      • serverTasks

        protected abstract void serverTasks()
        The internal timer is responsible for making scheduler of server tasks. In every interval in mili-seconds, the timer calls the method callServerTasks() which in turn calls the method serverTasks(). Specified tasks of server are coded in the method serverTasks().

      • addStatusListener

        public boolean addStatusListener(ServerStatusListener listener)
                          throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: Server
        Server has six statuses as follows:
        • "started": Server started. If server has just started right after calling Server.start(), it is in two statuses: "started" and "running".
        • "paused": Server paused. Server are currently in both "started" status and "paused" status.
        • "resumed": Server resumed. Server are currently in three statuses: "started", "resumed", and "running".
        • "stopped": Server stopped and so server is in "stopped" status.
        • "setconfig": Server is in setting its configuration. Sever must stop so that it can set its configuration. So server is now in two statuses: "stopped" and "setconfig".
        • "exit": Server exits and so server does not exist. Status "exit" is unreal.
        Some statuses are overlapped; for example, server is in status "paused" is also in status "started". When server changes its current status by calling methods such as Server.start(), Server.pause(), Server.resume(), Server.stop(), and Server.exit(). Methods such as Server.isStarted(), Server.isPaused(), and Server.isRunning() are used to query current status of server. Every time server change its current status, it notifies an event ServerStatusEvent to listeners that implement ServerStatusListener interface. Such listeners are called server status listeners, which must be registered with server by this method Server.addStatusListener(ServerStatusListener) to receive server status events. A server status event is removed from server by calling Server.removeStatusListener(ServerStatusListener).
        Specified by:
        addStatusListener in interface Server
        Parameters:
        listener - the server status listener that is registered into this server in order to receive server status event represented by ServerStatusEvent class.
        Returns:
        whether add listener successfully
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if any error raises.

      • ping

        public boolean ping()
             throws java.rmi.RemoteException

        Testing whether server is working properly even though it stopped.

      • removeStatusListener

        public boolean removeStatusListener(ServerStatusListener listener)
                             throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Description copied from interface: Server
        Server has six statuses as follows:
        • "started": Server started. If server has just started right after calling Server.start(), it is in two statuses: "started" and "running".
        • "paused": Server paused. Server are currently in both "started" status and "paused" status.
        • "resumed": Server resumed. Server are currently in three statuses: "started", "resumed", and "running".
        • "stopped": Server stopped and so server is in "stopped" status.
        • "setconfig": Server is in setting its configuration. Sever must stop so that it can set its configuration. So server is now in two statuses: "stopped" and "setconfig".
        • "exit": Server exits and so server does not exist. Status "exit" is unreal.
        Some statuses are overlapped; for example, server is in status "paused" is also in status "started". When server changes its current status by calling methods such as Server.start(), Server.pause(), Server.resume(), Server.stop(), and Server.exit(). Methods such as Server.isStarted(), Server.isPaused(), and Server.isRunning() are used to query current status of server. Every time server change its current status, it notifies an event ServerStatusEvent to listeners that implement ServerStatusListener interface. Such listeners are called server status listeners, which must be registered with server by this method Server.addStatusListener(ServerStatusListener) to receive server status events. A server status event is unregistered from server by calling this method Server.removeStatusListener(ServerStatusListener).
        Specified by:
        removeStatusListener in interface Server
        Parameters:
        listener - the server status listener that is unregistered from server and it no longer received server status event.
        Returns:
        whether add listener successfully
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - if any error raises.

      • getStatusListeners

        public ServerStatusListener[] getStatusListeners()
        Getting the array of server status listeners of this server. Such listeners were registered and stored in listenerList. Note, every time server change its current status, it notifies an event ServerStatusEvent to listeners that implement the ServerStatusListener interface.
        Returns:
        array of ServerStatusListener (s).

      • fireStatusEvent

        protected void fireStatusEvent(ServerStatusEvent evt)
        Firing a status event to server status listeners of this server. Such listeners were registered and stored in listenerList. Note, every time server change its current status, it notifies an event ServerStatusEvent to listeners that implement the ServerStatusListener interface.
        Parameters:
        evt - event indicating status of server.

      • stopDelegators

        protected void stopDelegators()
        This method stops running delegators of this server. Note, a delegator when is responsible for handling and processing incoming request that server dispatches to it.

      • pauseDelegators

        protected void pauseDelegators()
        This method pauses running delegators of this server. Note, a delegator when is responsible for handling and processing incoming request that server dispatches to it.

      • resumeDelegators

        protected void resumeDelegators()
        This method resumes paused delegators of this server. Note, a delegator when is responsible for handling and processing incoming request that server dispatches to it.
